instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL9239: What is ISL9239? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
threads.message:
This arrived with no liquid damage. Issue is when charger is plugged in it will act as though its being plugged in and out every few seconds. <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with charger and battery 11.15V. 11.50v with battery alone.

12.65v with charger alone but only low battery symbol appears on the screen.

Replaced <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP> and <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> since ohm reading was OL. No changes. <RESISTOR>R7030</RESISTOR>/40 appear to be good. <TRANSISTOR>Q7065</TRANSISTOR> is not shorted.

What to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
threads.message:
"and <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> since ohm reading was OL"
<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> can't fix that!
Check <RESISTOR>R7061</RESISTOR>/62...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
threads.message: Do you still have OL over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> (ohm scale)?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
threads.message:
1.6 + 1.6 = 21.5 for sure???
Check now <RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR> and related traces to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7061</RESISTOR>/62 reading anywhere from 1.6-2ohm 

<CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> 21.5 ohm red probe <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> black probe ground ohm modes

<RESISTOR>R7060</RESISTOR> and traces to <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> are fine. When the board first boots with battery and charger connected (after both have been disconnected)  it appears to be charging fine, however once charger is unplugged and plugged back in the system will then act as if itâ€™s being plugged in and unplugged every other second on all ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
threads.message:
So you've checked <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> to ground???
I didn't expect that...

Really strange to get 21 ohm to ground; unless you didn't let sufficient time to discharge remanent power, after disconnect charger and battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> won't charge battery
threads.message:
Yes I will measure again but should be fine since <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> was replaced along with the <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP>

what should be checked next??

S3 and S0 voltages go off after that?
L7211 voltage disappears, or go to1V?
